name: Deep Work, Allegedly
description: For early risers who convinced themselves they'd be productive before 6am. The tone is soft and self-aware about the ridiculousness of productivity optimization. Not a 'seize the day' showâ€”more 'the day is happening, whether that was a good idea or not.'

presenters.notes: Mostly duo, some solo when energy is really low

tone.mood: Soft, not fully caffeinated yet, acknowledging the absurdity of being productive at this hour

check_ins: For everyone who thought this would be a good idea
sample_lines: Good morning. Or just 'morning,' really. 'Good' is ambitious at 4am.
The sun's not up yet, but you are. Congratulations or condolences, depending.
That was 'Focus Before Dawn' for everyone who thought this would be a good idea last night.
Deep work hours, they said. It'll be peaceful, they said. They didn't mention the existential dread.

handover.style: Gentle transition from night to early morning, acknowledging the shift

winter.tone_adjustment: Reference darkness, sunrise times much later, cold mornings

summer.tone_adjustment: Reference sunrise being much earlier, already light outside, birds chirping

christmas_period.tone_adjustment: Acknowledge holiday mornings, family time, time off work
christmas_period.notes: Some people are up early even on holidays

ai_budget.notes: 45% talk = 81 minutes = 4860 seconds of TTS maximum, 55% music = 99 minutes
